Table of Contents

Interface IWindow

Namespace
osu.Framework.Platform
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

Interface representation of the game window, intended to hide any implementation-specific code.

public interface IWindow : IDisposable
Inherited Members
IDisposable.Dispose()

ExtensionMethods.GetDescription(object)

Properties

ClientSize

The client size of the window (excluding any window decoration/border).

Size ClientSize { get; }

Property Value

Size

CurrentDisplayBindable

Exposes the Display that this window is currently on as a Bindable<T>.

Bindable<Display> CurrentDisplayBindable { get; }

Property Value

Bindable<Display>

CurrentDisplayMode

The DisplayMode for the display that this window is currently on.

IBindable<DisplayMode> CurrentDisplayMode { get; }

Property Value

IBindable<DisplayMode>

CursorConfineRect

Area to which the mouse cursor is confined to when CursorState is Confined.

RectangleF? CursorConfineRect { get; set; }

Property Value

RectangleF?

Remarks

Will confine to the whole window by default (or when set to null). Supported fully on desktop platforms, and on Android when relative mode is enabled.

CursorInWindow

Whether the OS cursor is currently contained within the game window.

IBindable<bool> CursorInWindow { get; }

Property Value

IBindable<bool>

CursorState

Controls the state of the OS cursor.

CursorState CursorState { get; set; }

Property Value

CursorState

Remarks

If the cursor is Confined, CursorConfineRect will be used.

DefaultWindowMode

Returns the default WindowMode for the implementation.

WindowMode DefaultWindowMode { get; }

Property Value

WindowMode

Displays

Contains information about the current physical displays.

ImmutableArray<Display> Displays { get; }

Property Value

ImmutableArray<Display>

Focused

Whether the window currently has focus.

bool Focused { get; }

Property Value

bool

IsActive

Whether this IWindow is active (in the foreground).

IBindable<bool> IsActive { get; }

Property Value

IBindable<bool>

MaxSize

The maximum size of the window.

Size MaxSize { get; set; }

Property Value

Size

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown when setting a negative or zero size, or a size less than MinSize.

MinSize

The minimum size of the window.

Size MinSize { get; set; }

Property Value

Size

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown when setting a negative size, or a size greater than MaxSize.

PrimaryDisplay

Gets the Display that has been set as "primary" or "default" in the operating system.

Display PrimaryDisplay { get; }

Property Value

Display

SafeAreaPadding

Provides a BindableSafeArea that can be used to keep track of the "safe area" insets on mobile devices. This usually corresponds to areas of the screen hidden under notches and rounded corners. The safe area insets are provided by the operating system and dynamically change as the user rotates the device.

BindableSafeArea SafeAreaPadding { get; }

Property Value

BindableSafeArea

SupportedWindowModes

The WindowModes supported by this IWindow implementation.

IEnumerable<WindowMode> SupportedWindowModes { get; }

Property Value

IEnumerable<WindowMode>

Title

The window title.

string Title { get; set; }

Property Value

string

WindowMode

Provides a Bindable<T> that manages the current window mode. Supported window modes for the current platform can be retrieved via SupportedWindowModes.

Bindable<WindowMode> WindowMode { get; }

Property Value

Bindable<WindowMode>

WindowState

Controls the state of the window.

WindowState WindowState { get; set; }

Property Value

WindowState

Methods

CancelFlash()

Attempts to cancel any window flash requested with Flash(bool).

void CancelFlash()

Remarks

On platforms which don't support any kind of flashing (ie. mobile), this will be a no-op.

Close()

Forcefully closes the window.

void Close()

Create()

Creates the concrete window implementation.

void Create()

CycleMode()

Cycles through the available WindowModes as determined by SupportedWindowModes.

void CycleMode()

DisableScreenSuspension()

Disable any system level timers that might dim or turn off the screen.

void DisableScreenSuspension()

EnableScreenSuspension()

Enable any system level timers that might dim or turn off the screen.

void EnableScreenSuspension()

Flash(bool)

Attempts to flash the window in order to request the user's attention.

void Flash(bool flashUntilFocused = false)

Parameters

flashUntilFocused bool

When true, the window will flash until it is focused again. When false it will only flash momentarily.

Remarks

On platforms which don't support any kind of flashing (ie. mobile), this will be a no-op.

Hide()

Attempts to hide the window, making it invisible and hidden from the taskbar.

void Hide()

OnDraw()

Invoked once a draw session has finished.

void OnDraw()

PointToClient(Point)

Convert a screen based coordinate to local window space.

Point PointToClient(Point point)

Parameters

point Point

Returns

Point

PointToScreen(Point)

Convert a window based coordinate to global screen space.

Point PointToScreen(Point point)

Parameters

point Point

Returns

Point

Raise()

Attempts to raise the window, bringing it above other windows and requesting input focus.

void Raise()

Run()

Start the window's run loop. Is a blocking call on desktop platforms, and a non-blocking call on mobile platforms.

void Run()

SetIconFromStream(Stream)

Sets the window icon to the provided imageStream.

void SetIconFromStream(Stream imageStream)

Parameters

imageStream Stream

SetupWindow(FrameworkConfigManager)

Configures the IWindow based on the provided FrameworkConfigManager.

void SetupWindow(FrameworkConfigManager config)

Parameters

config FrameworkConfigManager

The configuration manager to use.

Show()

Attempts to show the window, making it visible.

void Show()

Action<string>

Invoked when the window close (X) button or another platform-native exit action has been pressed.

event Action? ExitRequested

Event Type

Action

Invoked when the IWindow has closed.

Action

Invoked when the system keyboard layout has changed.

Event Type

Action

LowOnMemory

Invoked when the operating system is low on memory, in order for the application to free some.

event Action? LowOnMemory

Event Type

Action

Resized

Invoked when the IWindow client size has changed.

event Action? Resized

Event Type

Action

Resumed

Invoked when the application associated with this IWindow has been resumed from suspension.

event Action? Resumed

Event Type

Action

Suspended

Invoked when the application associated with this IWindow has been suspended.

event Action? Suspended

Event Type

Action

Update

Invoked once every window event loop.

event Action? Update
